title: Strategic Partnerships via IHC House at Davos
description: IHC House @ Davos serves as a hub for global leaders from investment, financial services, healthcare, technology, and space sectors to engage in high-level collaboration and partnership formation under the theme 'Collaboration for the Intelligent Age.' IHC orchestrates events and panel sessions involving international players and key portfolio CEOs, opening its network for potential partners.
example: Technology or financial services companies (e.g., ServiceNow, Blackstone, JP Morgan) can propose joint pilot projects with IHC subsidiaries (such as Multiply Group or Modon Holding) for regional expansion into the UAE and Middle Eastern markets. For example, a European fintech could collaborate with IHC on digital asset management, leveraging IHC’s network and regulatory expertise to test and expand fintech solutions in the region.
roadmap: Identify sector-specific strategic interests among IHC subsidiaries and external companies.
Set up introductory sessions at IHC House @ Davos to explore partnership interests and map synergies.
Establish working groups to scope pilot initiatives (e.g., digital healthcare, advanced manufacturing, or fintech deployments).
Sign Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) for co-development or market entry pilots.
Implement pilot projects, measure outcomes, and showcase results at future global events.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

title: Healthcare Innovation Collaboration through PureHealth and IHC Network
description: PureHealth, a portfolio company of IHC, is focused on redefining healthcare delivery and longevity. At Davos, it seeks international collaborators in health tech, biotech, and medical devices to drive projects that can be scaled across the Middle East and beyond.
example: A US or European health tech startup developing AI-driven diagnostics or cancer care solutions could partner with PureHealth to localize, pilot, and commercialize their technology in the UAE. PureHealth’s health system access and regulatory navigation offer valuable go-to-market support.
roadmap: Health tech company approaches PureHealth via IHC’s network or Davos events.
Joint workshops held to align on technology fit and market needs.
Set up pilot study framework in UAE healthcare ecosystem.
Rapid regulatory and market access supported by PureHealth.
Scale-up plans for commercialization and regional expansion.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

title: M&A and Investment Opportunities with IHC and Subsidiaries
description: Multiply Group, part of IHC, is actively seeking acquisition opportunities to expand their portfolio globally in consumer discretionary and other growth sectors. Cross-border M&A can enable international firms to enter the fast-growing UAE and Gulf markets leveraging Multiply/IHC’s capital and local insights.
example: A European direct-to-consumer brand in health wellness could negotiate acquisition or significant investment from Multiply Group, using Dubai and Abu Dhabi as beachheads for Middle East and South Asia expansion, benefiting from IHC's local regulatory knowledge and retail channels.
roadmap: International companies express interest in expansion via Multiply Group at WEF or through official channels.
Facilitate due diligence and strategic alignment workshops.
Negotiate investment terms, with Multiply Group providing capital, market access, and operational guidance.
Formalize acquisition/investment deals.
Support integration and regional market entry.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

title: Cross-Sector Technology Pilots Addressing Food Security, Space Tech, and ESG
description: IHC’s involvement with entities like Cargill (food & agri), Marlan Space (space technology), and global regulators (COP30 Dinner) sets the stage for cross-sector pilot projects that combine technology, ESG imperatives, and resource challenges (food, space, energy).
example: An agritech company focused on indoor farming tech can partner with IHC, Cargill, or Grupo Nutresa for joint deployments in desert agriculture, leveraging IHC’s investment and land assets. Similarly, a space tech startup could work with Marlan Space on satellite-based earth observation projects tailored to agriculture or climate change.
roadmap: Outreach to relevant partners through IHC House and dedicated Davos sessions.
Matchmaking between IHC’s subsidiaries and external innovation players.
Scoping of multi-stakeholder pilot projects (e.g., smart farming with satellite analytics).
Joint funding proposals and pilot launches in the UAE or Middle East.
Measure outcomes; expand winning initiatives regionally or globally.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025
